text.p: Oscar Gruss and Son said in a report released on Wednesday that it had lowered its investment rating for Cimatron Ltd, an Israeli software company, to hold from buy.
"We estimate earnings per share in each of the first three quarters in 1997 to be lower than earnings in the comparable quarters in 1996," it said, without citing figures.

"We anticipate the first quarter to be especially weak, with flat net income or net income slightly below the same period in 1996. We therefore are lowering our investment rating to hold from buy," the report said.
It said it expected only moderate growth of 15.3 percent in full-year 1997 in earnings, with the bulk of that to come at the end of the year.
The report said Cimatron shares were fairly valued and at their current price "represent an unfavourable risk/reward profile".
